page.title: 01GENERAL
page.content: This survey area mainly covers two parts of{St Helens Metropolitan } {Borough;}all of Blackbrook and part of Haydock. Haydock was known in 1169 as Hedoc and assumed its current spelling in 1286. The name probably originated from the words Haidd (meaning barley) and either Docce (plant) or Dokk (hollow). Barley has been an important crop here for many centuries. The importance of farming diminished in the face of burgeoning industry, having a striking effect on the landscape. At one time Haydock was called "Yickville" and its inhabitants were "Yickers". It has also been described as "part of Lancashire's unacceptable backside: a nondescript left-over of the Industrial Revolution",(Lancashire Life, April 1981).
